Description: A SAFe Agilist is a key player in Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe) for enterprises. The role is responsible for promoting and implementing SAFe practices across the organization to ensure alignment with the overall business objectives. The SAFe Agilist is a change agent, coach, and servant leader, helping teams and stakeholders understand and adopt SAFe principles and practices. The role requires an in-depth understanding of the SAFe framework, Lean-Agile values, and principles, and strong facilitation, coaching, and leadership skills. The SAFe Agilist collaborates with teams, management, and other stakeholders to identify opportunities for improvement and drives the continuous improvement of the organization's Agile processes and practices. The SAFe Agilist's ultimate goal is to enable the organization to deliver high-quality, value-driven solutions to customers in a fast and efficient manner.

Required.SkillDescription: Strong understanding of Agile and SAFe methodologies and experience in implementing and managing these practices at the enterprise level

Required.SkillName: Agile Release Train Planning and Execution
Required.SkillDescription: Experience in Agile Release Train planning and execution, and the ability to manage multiple teams and stakeholders within the ART
Ability to facilitate meetings and workshops, and to coach team members on Agile and SAFe practices and principles
Ability to build and lead high-performing Agile teams, and to foster a culture of collaboration, continuous improvement, and transparency
Ability to identify and solve problems, and to resolve conflicts within the Agile Release Train and across the enterprise
Ability to identify areas for improvement and to facilitate continuous improvement at the Agile Release Train and enterprise levels

Recommended.SkillDescription: Certification in SAFe methodologies, such as SAFe Agilist (SA), SAFe Program Consultant (SPC), or SAFe Lean Portfolio Manager (LPM)
Experience in Lean-Agile leadership, including the ability to drive organizational change and to build a Lean-Agile culture

Understanding of business concepts and the ability to align Agile and SAFe practices with business objectives and priorities
Understanding of technical concepts and the ability to communicate effectively with technical team members and stakeholders
Understanding of risk management principles and techniques, and the ability to identify and mitigate potential risks associated with Agile Release Train and portfolio operations
Ability to analyze data and metrics related to the Agile Release Train and the enterprise, and to use this information to improve team performance and business outcomes
Understanding of DevOps practices and their integration with Agile and SAFe practices, and the ability to work effectively with DevOps teams
Understanding of Big Data technologies and the ability to apply Agile and SAFe practices to Big Data projects
